Jake Sully.Action: Reflects on his difficult personal circumstances with awareness and acceptance.
Pushes forward in his wheelchair determinedly despite physical challenges and a harsh environment.
Shows awareness and wariness from his past combat experience, indicating mental preparedness.
Reflects on his limited options for medical treatment due to economic and bureaucratic constraints.
Observes a man abusing a woman in a bar and does not look away, starts moving his wheelchair towards the scene.
Balances a tequila shot on his forehead in a rowdy bar, enjoying the attention of other disabled vets.
Balances his chair on two wheels while holding a tequila shot on his forehead, impressing onlookers.
Struggles laboriously to pull his pants off due to atrophied legs.
Observes a violent situation in the bar and decides not to look away, preparing to intervene by pushing the wheelchair forward.
Intervenes to stop a bully by physically confronting him despite personal risk.
Calls the bouncer a 'candy ass bitch' after being thrown out of the bar.
Reflects solemnly on his brother Tommy's death and the cold treatment of his body by the agents.
Reflects on his brother's skills and his own background realistically without false bravado.
Shows emotional response to his brother's death but remains composed and observant.
Refers to himself as 'just another dumb grunt' indicating low self-confidence and self-doubt about his own capabilities.
Struggles to put on exo-pack breathing gear while others do so with practiced moves.
Pumps his wheelchair to move down the ramp and looks around attentively, noticing arrows stuck in the tractor's tires.
Uses crude language ('limpdicks') when addressing Wainfleet and Fike, showing a brusque and confrontational demeanor.
Stares at the gnashing fangs of the dying alien, suggesting a moment of contemplation or respect towards the creature.
Casually rolls through a heavily armed and dangerous perimeter in a wheelchair, showing confidence and disregard for danger.
Provokes Wainfleet and Fike by calling them limpdicks and daring their stares, showing boldness but potentially lacking tact.
Remains calm when a lethal creature (Stingbat) attacks near him, staring at its fangs without panic.
Mesmerized as he stares into the tank at his avatar, shows wonder and openness.
Talks casually and with self-deprecating humor about doing science and being new to a lab.
Waits patiently while Norm and Grace converse in Na'vi without interrupting.
Responds honestly and directly about his brother's death despite the awkwardness.
Runs joyfully across the compound and revels in the surroundings, showing enthusiasm and openness.
Responds to Grace warmly and with recognition, engaging in friendly banter and accepts fruit she throws him.
Does not react negatively or dismissively to Norm's boasting display, merely turns to look.
Agrees to help Trudy by taking a door gun position when asked.
Nods confidently to Quaritch's instructions and accepts the challenging mission to learn about the natives and gain their trust while reporting to a tough superior.
Follows Quaritch as he demonstrates skill and control with the 'suit,' showing respect and attentiveness to a capable mentor.
Casually responds to Grace's question about what Atilla wanted with a light comment about 'Marines comparin' tattoos,' indicating informal communication, but no clear competence indicator.
Acknowledges Grace's warning and accepts being in her world ('Got it').
Responds with sarcasm about being skinned and made into a drum, showing skepticism but not hostility.
Looks up warily at the stingbats, showing awareness and caution.
Touches the blackboard with bullet holes, showing curiosity and concern about what happened.
Watches Grace after her sharp remark, but does not respond defensively or rudely.
Looks behind him feeling unseen eyes, cautious and alert while approaching the school ruins.
Explores the abandoned school ruins carefully, observing surroundings including bullet holes on the blackboard.
Asks Grace about what happened at the school ruins, showing awareness and seeking information.
Watches Grace closely and awkwardly jams equipment into his pack when asked to help, indicating some hesitation or lack of immediate initiative.
Raises his rifle in response to a perceived threat.
Listens and begins to back away when Grace advises him not to shoot and to hold his ground.
Jams equipment into his pack efficiently while observing surroundings.
Scouts ahead of the group despite boredom, showing initiative.
Interacts with the helicoradians out of curiosity, inadvertently triggering a chain reaction.
Raises his rifle quickly when threatened by the hammerhead titanothere.
Hesitates and asks Grace what to do in a threatening situation, showing some uncertainty.
Attempts to back away from the creature despite being told not to run, indicating momentary lack of confidence or understanding.
Runs straight at a charging hammerhead to protect others, using a bold gambit to stop it.
Uses aggressive language and bravado in confronting the hammerhead and thanator.
Struggles to survive after falling down the waterfall, showing resilience but no direct social interaction.
Fights off viperwolves aggressively to protect himself.
Improvises a torch using a T-shirt and sap, lights it with a waterproof match to create light for moving through darkness.
Moves warily along the trail aware of predators, showing alertness and caution.
Crosses a steep banked stream on a horizontal trunk without thinking, indicating quick reaction but possible recklessness.
Stops dead after crossing, realizing he is encircled by enemies, showing awareness of danger.
Uses torch aggressively to fend off attacking viperwolves, jabbing one with a spear and keeping others at bay.
Feels a rush of adrenaline and overcomes fear, maintaining composure in a high-threat situation.
Fights fiercely to protect himself from attacking wolves despite injury and pain.
Cracks spear on enemy, plants spear true but loses weapon; draws knife and cuts deep into attacking wolf, escapes multiple attacks by viperwolves and wolves.
Loses spear when attacked, torch goes flying leaving him in semi-darkness; struggles to escape multiple simultaneous attacks and is nearly overwhelmed.
Sprints and scrambles to get up despite pain and being attacked from multiple directions.
Barely manages to keep wolf's jaws away from his face by catching its throat in time.
Kicks wounded wolf away but keeps it from snapping his face, shows physical bravery and protective instinct.
Expresses gratitude to Neytiri—'Look, um, I know you probably don't understand this. But -- thanks. Thank you. I owe you.'
Does not intervene or argue when Neytiri ends the suffering of the dying wolf and performs her ritual, showing respect and tolerance for her actions and culture.
Pins and chokes a wolf to stop its attack, showing physical capability and presence of mind under threat.
Scrambles to recover his spear in the dark after the torch is extinguished, displaying quick reaction and situational awareness.
Attempts to thank Neytiri and communicate despite cultural and language barriers, indicating social intelligence and earnestness.
Asks Neytiri not to extinguish the torch without understanding the environment’s bioluminescence, demonstrating a learning attitude and adaptability.
Thanks Neytiri for killing the threatening creatures, showing gratitude.
Grasps Neytiri's shoulder without permission, leading to her anger.
Apologizes sincerely after Neytiri expresses anger and blames him for the death of animals.
Engages in a calm dialogue despite being threatened with the bow at his throat, showing tolerance and composure.
Goes after Neytiri when she turns away upset, showing persistence and concern.
Asks Neytiri to teach him and expresses willingness to learn despite being called ignorant.
Tries to smooth over tension with Neytiri by saying they got off on the wrong foot and wants her to get to know him.
Carelessly loses his spear and almost falls, but Neytiri helps him; Jake does not show embarrassment or anger, accepting her help.
Asks Neytiri for help and to take him with her despite her initial rejection.
Remains calm and open when touched by the woodsprites, showing receptiveness and trust despite potential fear.
Curiously and gently interacts with the environment, showing wonder and sincerity in experiencing the new world.
Asks Neytiri her name, showing curiosity and an attempt to engage
Instinctively runs from the Na'vi riders and tries to escape when threatened
Remained composed despite being roughly hauled forward and encircled by hostile tribe members.
Is amazed by the size and features of Hometree instead of reacting with fear or panic.
Smiles in response when Neytiri teases him about pronouncing her name.
Tries to initiate friendly conversation by asking Neytiri's name and repeats it appreciatively.
Offers some reassurance by telling the clan members not to get up as he enters the circle.
Commands the clan not to get up as he enters, showing confidence and control in a tense social situation.
Engages Neytiri playfully and responds to her baiting with a smile, indicating social intelligence and confidence.
Fails to understand the gravity of the situation or others’ distrust towards him, indicated by casual remarks and joking tone.
Accepts Neytiri's challenge to eat the beetle larvae and responds positively, likening it to 'grandma's teylu.'
Successfully integrates with the Omaticaya, gaining their trust to the point of being offered a spare room and car keys.
Expresses confidence by stating 'It's not something you can teach,' indicating natural skill or adaptability.
Receives praise and congratulations from peers and superiors (Max, Quaritch) for his approach and results.
Asks relevant questions about the indigenous people's relocation and the politics involved, showing awareness of the situation.
Acknowledges the responsibility he has been given and responds confidently: 'I'm on it.'
Engages actively with Grace and Norm by learning clan member names and their roles, demonstrating a willingness to learn.
Does not display hesitation or confusion about his task, instead shows earnest effort despite the challenge.
Grins at the little girl who laughs and runs back to play with her friends.
Makes a teasing comment about having a date with the chief's daughter.
Shows nervousness and awkwardness while mounting the mare.
Clumsily tries to bond with the horse, showing vulnerability and willingness to learn despite repeated failure and falling off.
Responds to Tsu'tey's disdain with a light joke, acknowledging hostility without escalating conflict.
Tries to mount and ride a direhorse by forming a neural bond but repeatedly falls off and lands painfully; struggles to maintain control.
Despite repeated failures and being covered in mud, he gets up and tries again, showing persistence.
Explains Hometree's inner structure clearly to military officers and engineers.
Explains plans of Hometree's inner structure clearly and confidently to military officers and engineers.
Acknowledges Quaritch's request for accurate scans promptly and cooperatively.
Looks at Grace's pictures with children and local people with apparent interest and respect.
Responds to Norm's glare with a casual 'Hey. You got a problem?'
Asks questions and shows willingness to learn despite not understanding the maglev effect.
Engages in a tense exchange with Norm, asserting himself confidently.
Is perceived by Norm as inexperienced and unprepared, being derogatorily called a 'turnip truck' faller, indicating others doubt his competence.
Tries to keep up with Neytiri as she leaps up the core trunk like a lemur, showing effort to engage and connect.
Expresses awe and respect silently ('Holy shit') upon seeing the mountain banshee, showing open-mindedness and genuine reaction.
Ducks instinctively during Neytiri's swooping flyby, showing trust and respect.
Expresses tiredness and reluctance but continues to engage in video log, shows sincerity and openness.
Attempts to learn Na'vi language with Neytiri's help, indicating patience and willingness to connect.
Neytiri smacks him roughly to correct his posture, and he internally accepts her harsh method without resentment.
Thinks that Neytiri and Norm consider him a retard, but continues interactions without apparent hostility.
Responds politely to Norm's help with language, engaging in friendly but sometimes strained exchanges.
Mentally notes Norm's improvement and reconnects, showing tolerance and hope for others.
Follows Neytiri's lead, trusting her and showing willingness to learn despite danger and challenge.
Follows Neytiri in a dangerous leap of faith, showing trust and willingness to connect.
Thinks fondly about Grace and her kindness, appreciating her sincerity.
Learns from Neytiri with patience and genuine interest, showing respect and openness.
Asserts control over his video-log in a polite way ('Excuse me -- this is my video-log here, okay?').
Moves gracefully and harmoniously with Neytiri in the night forest, suggesting a respectful and gentle connection.
Displays excitement and shares triumph by holding up a fish after bow-fishing, showing openness and shared enjoyment.
Maintains focus and nervousness when Neytiri's hands are gentle on him, suggesting vulnerability and sincerity.
Engages respectfully in quiet, slow movement as signaled by Neytiri, showing attentiveness and tolerance to her ways.
Moves gracefully and soundlessly through the night forest, demonstrating good coordination and adaptation to the environment.
Successfully drills a fish with a bow and holds it up triumphantly, showing skill and confidence in hunting.
Focus is broken when Neytiri touches him while he is drawing his bow, indicating a lapse in concentration under distraction.
Attempts to cautiously follow Neytiri's signals and move slowly in the clearing, showing attentiveness and respect for his guide's instructions.
Inside the link, experiences confusion and weakness, not knowing where he is, showing vulnerability and temporary disorientation.
Keeps up with Tsu'tey and teenage hunters on a dangerous mountain trail without complaint or hesitation.
Uses friendly, inclusive language with Tsu'tey: 'We doin' this?'
Lets Neytiri take his hand and feels a rush of emotion but she breaks away like it didn't happen.
Faces the banshee directly and calmly, showing courage and determination.
Calls out 'Let's dance' to the banshee, displaying confidence with a friendly challenge.
Uses violence to subdue the banshee by tying its jaws with a bolo and tackling it around the neck.
Looks directly into the banshee's eyes and confidently approaches it.
Uses a weighted bolo to time the banshee's lunge and successfully ties its jaws shut.
Leaps over the banshee's talons and tackles it quickly despite the threat.
Playfully pulls back meat from his banshee to teach it to eat more slowly, then strokes its long head.
Shares information about the Leonopteryx in a straightforward and engaging manner with others.
Stops Grace on an image to point out the sacred site, showing sincere interest and respect for Na'vi culture.
Accepts the kava bowl offered by Tsu'tey and shares drink in a gesture of camaraderie.
Performs with young hunters, engaging playfully during the Hunt Festival.
Responds to Tsu'tey's teasing insult with a simple apology.
Kills the beast skillfully with an arrow, demonstrating marksmanship and bravery.
Accepts Tsu'tey's challenge/olive branch by drinking the kava confidently despite warnings, showing social tact and confidence.
Acts out the leonopteryx attack with enthusiasm and leadership among young hunters, inspiring them.
Joins the circle of dancers despite initial protest; lets himself go and connects deeply with the dance and Neytiri.
Takes Grace's hand and pulls her up to dance despite her protests.
Wakes up after three months in the Link feeling pale, haggard, and disoriented, expressing confusion about his identity.
Maintains a video log despite deteriorating physical and mental condition, showing some level of discipline and reflection.
Responds to Selfridge’s questioning with a mixture of impatience and assertiveness, pressing for clear communication.
Shows determination and sincerity when stating he can continue the mission despite doubts from Quaritch.
Feels hollow inside, knowing what he's done.
Determined to complete the Dream Hunt despite risks; pushes Grace away when she warns him.
Admits he was sent to deceive the Omaticaya but states he is not that person anymore.
Expresses conflict and vulnerability about his divided loyalties and possible rejection by both sides.
Participates obediently and reverently in the Na'vi purification ritual, enduring discomfort and unknown effects without complaint.
Endures a painful ritual involving a stinging arachnoid and consuming a strange glowing worm to gain a vision, showing willingness to undergo difficult and unknown challenges.
Experiences intense physical and sensory distortions during the vision, ultimately vomiting, indicating limits to his physical endurance or preparedness for the ritual.
His intense physical and spiritual struggle during the venom transformation shows endurance but no direct interaction or expression of warmth toward others in this excerpt.
Endures intense physical agony and mental strain during a vision quest, ultimately completing the ritual as overseen by clan elders.
Allows the entire clan to place their hands on him, connecting physically and symbolically as a son of the Omaticaya.
Stands weakly but accepts Eytukan's acknowledgment and inclusion into the clan, showing willingness to embrace his new role despite uncertainty.
Looks up at the Leonopteryx Skull Totem, indicating awareness of the weight of responsibility and tradition.
Physically connects with clan members, showing openness and confidence in his acceptance by the group.
Refuses other women and directly expresses having already chosen Neytiri, focusing sincerely on a genuine connection.
Gently puts fingers on Neytiri's lips to stop her, showing tenderness and respect.
Observes and interacts thoughtfully with the Tree of Voices, showing awareness and openness to Na'vi culture.
Calmly asserts his choice of partner and clearly communicates his feelings, demonstrating confident decision-making and interpersonal skill.
Strokes Neytiri's face tenderly and engages in intimate, sincere connection.
Responds openly and positively to Neytiri's declaration of being mated for life, showing acceptance and openness.
Engages in the Na'vi bonding ritual with sincere attention and tenderness, showing emotional intelligence.
Asks questions about mating customs, showing openness and willingness to understand new culture.
Appears somewhat uncertain or surprised about important cultural information (mating for life) he was not previously told.
Pushes Grace's hands away and pulls the lid down when she comments on his hygiene.
Runs into the path of the bulldozer and waves his arms to stop it, risking himself to protect the forest.
Climbs onto the dozer and smashes the camera lens to stop the destruction.
Dives off the dozer to avoid shooting and grabs Neytiri, seeking to protect her.
Takes Neytiri's arm firmly to stop her from advancing, preparing to communicate something difficult calmly and privately.
Handles being unexpectedly attacked by Tsu'tey with composure, standing up and reaching out to Neytiri for support.
Accepts Tsu'tey's challenge to fight, indicating willingness to confront conflict directly.
Sidesteps and blocks Tsu'tey's knife attack, then elbows him hard in the face.
Accepts Tsu'tey's challenge confidently to engage in a proper fight.
Uses a staff to parry and match Tsu'tey's aggressive leaps, ducks, and strikes skillfully during their combat.
States 'It's the only way to get him to goddamn listen,' showing clear intention and strategic thinking.
Jake meets Quaritch's glare with a defiant look and stands his ground, attempting to mediate by urging Quaritch to listen to Grace to keep people alive.
Jake pounds a rock into the dozer camera lens while in avatar form, showing animalistic fury rather than strategic thinking.
Expresses a realistic and insightful assessment of the Na'vi's unwillingness to negotiate, recognizing their perspective and motives.
His recorded rambling late-night monologue shows signs of stress and borderline derangement, which indicates a momentary loss of confidence and clear-headedness.
Tries to intervene and talk Selfridge out of attacking the Na'vi, urging peaceful resolution and showing concern for innocent lives, including children.
Speaks sincerely and respectfully to the Na'vi clan in their language, warning them to evacuate to avoid deadly attack.
Offers to negotiate with the Na'vi to prevent bloodshed; takes responsibility to speak to the clan and warn them about the impending attack.
Speaks in clear Na'vi to the clan, showing preparation and confidence in communication.
Appears to understand the urgency and gravity of the situation and tries to influence decisions.
Yells urgently at Neytiri, Tsu'tey, and others to get out of Hometree and run to the forest, showing presence of mind under pressure.
Struggles with his bindings, then quickly frees himself and Grace when Mo'at cuts him free, immediately recognizing danger and urging rapid escape.
Searches for Neytiri amid swirling smoke and sparks during the attack.
Struggles emotionally, staggers lost and alone through the burning forest, eyes vacant.
Attempts to comfort Neytiri by kneeling next to her and apologizing.
Thanks Max and Trudy for rescuing him and the others.
Calls for a revolution together with the others, showing camaraderie and shared purpose.
Tells Max he needs someone he can trust on the inside, grips his hand tightly.
Calmly disarms the trooper, instructing him kindly to comply.
Looks at Grace, sees she is injured and covering a bleeding wound, and tells her to hang on.
Gives Grace morphine for the pain and insists on getting her help despite her refusal.
Gives Grace morphine for pain and insists on getting her help, showing determination and care.
Grabs Grace's shoulders and insists help is possible, displaying confidence and leadership in a crisis.
Calms the paralyzed Na'vi by calmly riding and then dismounting Toruk, stroking the animal's flank.
Walks directly toward Neytiri with powerful and pure emotion, connecting sincerely.
Expresses sincere emotion and solidarity by saying 'I See you' to Neytiri, reassuring her and taking her hand.
Publicly honors Tsu'tey and acknowledges his importance, showing respect and a collaborative spirit.
Begging the Matriarch for help to save Grace, demonstrating care and concern for others.
Gently carries Grace's human body like a child, showing tenderness and compassion.
Addresses the crowd confidently and respectfully, acknowledges Tsu'tey's skills and offers partnership.
Earns the support of Tsu'tey despite initial fear and incomprehension, showing leadership and diplomacy.
Carries Grace's human body with care and reverence into a sacred place, demonstrating emotional intelligence and respect.
Begging the help of the Great Mother shows humility and strategic awareness of cultural protocol.
Responds organically and appropriately to delicate spiritual rituals, showing adaptability and understanding.
Kneels next to Grace, holds her hand to comfort and reassure her despite the emotional weight.
Promises to do whatever it takes to help, showing emotional resolve and commitment.
Feels his throat close with emotion, indicating vulnerability but does not falter.
Calls for the clans to unite and resist after Grace's death, speaking with passion and fury.
Suggests negotiating with Selfridge to prevent escalation.
Acknowledges responsibility for the potential destruction, expresses determination to stop it.
Pushes himself physically despite exhaustion (grabbing freeze-dried crystals, settling for coffee).
Prepares and shares tactical plans with Neytiri and others (building trust, cooperation).
Teaches the Na'vi hunters the strategy using the sketched Scorpion gunship as a totem, and they absorb the lesson eagerly.
Engages in a sincere, almost humble moment speaking to the Mother Tree, expressing concern for the Na'vi and warning about the destructive ways of the Sky People.
Draws and explains a detailed plan to the Na'vi hunters, showing leadership and tactical thinking.
Shows hesitation and self-doubt when speaking to the Mother Tree about being inexperienced.
Effectively communicates the seriousness of the threat by referencing Grace's memories and warning the Na'vi.
Admits he could use a little help and stands ready to fight for the chosen cause.
Leans in to Neytiri, holding her and sharing a moment of peace before battle.
Volunteers to stand and fight, shows willingness to take responsibility and leadership, asks for help when needed.
Attempts to influence Neytiri and the Na'vi with a reasoned appeal but acknowledges the limited outcome ('It was worth a try').
Kicks the gunship loose from the leonopteryx attack, causing it to crash and explode.
Decides and communicates the need to stop the shuttles at all costs, coordinating with allies by headset.
Rolls in after Tsu'tey to engage in combat but is forced to evade incoming gunship fire, showing active participation but some vulnerability.
Leads a formation of hunters in a coordinated aerial attack to aid his allies.
Rushes into battle to protect and fight alongside others, showing commitment to their safety.
Drops on the hull of the Dragon from his leonopteryx, rolls to his feet and immediately starts running, showing agility, precision, and quick decision-making.
Attempts to deploy grenades on the enemy ship despite personal danger.
Warns comrades via headset about Quaritch's position and urges them to act.
Yanks two grenades from his battle-harness, pulls pins with his teeth, and throws them despite being flung off his feet.
Skids on the hull and is flung off the ship after the dragon lurches; shows agility and quick reflexes by catching leaves to break his fall.
Immediately recognizes the danger Quaritch poses and calls out a warning and a call for help via headset.
Falls multiple times during descent but manages to break his fall skillfully; not reckless despite danger.
Charges and tackles Quaritch to protect the Link and Neytiri.
Reaches around to grab Quaritch and smashes his face into the cockpit to prevent him from harming the Link.
Hits in a flying tackle with every ounce of force he has, knocking the ampsuit sideways.
Reaches around the suit, grabbing Quaritch's shoulder and yanks him forward hard, smashing his face into the edge of the cockpit.
Holds his breath inside the link as toxic Pandoran air swirls in, gas alarms shriek, showing focus and endurance.
Catches the knife attack in both hands despite the force driving him to his knees.
Slams to the ground after being flung off by Quaritch's arm sweep.
Shows reluctance to kill Tsu'tey but accepts his fate to end his suffering; recites a prayer for the dead with tears in his eyes.
Jake and Neytiri stand together watching the departure of the Sky People with a sense of shared solemnity.
Jake reflects on the healing of the forest and hearts of the People, expressing hope and connection with the world.
Jake records a personal videolog acknowledging the changes and his departure from the high tech world without bitterness.
Mentions attending a funeral for someone very close, indicating personal loss and emotional connection.
Stands calmly and thoughtfully watching the departure of the Sky People with Neytiri, showing composure.
Delivers a reflective and insightful videolog about the healing of the forest and the people, showing understanding and emotional intelligence.
Speaks candidly about not missing the high-tech link room, suggesting clear priorities and realistic self-assessment.
Mentions the importance of attending a funeral for someone close to him, indicating responsibility and commitment to social bonds.
Leaps from his wheelchair to physically confront a bully, demonstrating unexpected physical capability and aggression.
Continues fighting despite injury and being thrown out, showing determination and resilience.
Uses humor and sarcasm ('If it ain't rainin' we ain't trainin!') after being beaten, indicating mental toughness and confidence.
Engages aggressively and impulsively in a bar fight, potentially escalating conflict instead of seeking a strategic solution.
Pushes away from his capsule and moves to lockers in zero-G despite having paralyzed legs, showing adaptation and control.
Struggles to put on his exopack while others are ready, showing vulnerability but no complaint.
Responds to disparaging comments from Sec-Ops troopers with quiet observation rather than retaliation.
Shakes Norm's hand and engages politely despite wariness.
Responds briefly and somewhat reservedly to Norm's comments about his brother.
Shows curiosity and engagement as he observes his avatar and the scientific setup; acknowledges the need to document observations carefully as advised by Norm.
Appears unsure about how to handle the videolog communication, asking if he can say 'whatever' in it.
Waits patiently while others speak in fluent Na'vi and acknowledges Grace's dismissal with calm factual correction.
Shows no immediate response or effort to engage when Grace brusquely dismisses him in favor of his brother.
Admits to having no lab or technical training, only some high school chemistry that he did not complete.
Responds honestly and confidently despite lack of technical skills during questioning by Grace.
Assigned as security escort due to being a Marine and twin brother of his deceased sibling; no specific action yet demonstrating skill or confidence.
Refuses Grace's offered help to haul himself into the link chair, insisting 'Don't! I got this.'
Meets Grace's concerned question with a defiant glare and says he was 'just tired of doctors telling me what I couldn't do.'
Laughs and grins at Max after accidentally knocking over instruments, showing a playful, good-natured response.
Ignores Max and med techs' instructions and yanks off bio-monitor wires, pushing past them despite their protests.
Sits quietly and observes his environment, reacts with curiosity ('That's kinda freaky') when noticing the movement of his queue.
Follows routine by settling down and closing eyes to rest after the day's events.
Nods and agrees to learn about the Na'vi and gain their trust as ordered by Quaritch.
Shows respect and admiration for Quaritch's strength and determination.
Leaps out to secure the LZ with Wainfleet, scanning the treeline warily, weapons aimed.
Takes point as they enter the jungle, leading the group despite unfamiliar and dangerous environment.
White-knuckles his rifle and appears hyper-alert and tense, showing nervousness and lack of ease in the environment.
Dives under massive roots and rolls away from a deadly predator's attack multiple times, showing quick reflexes and adaptability.
Fires an AR point blank at the thanator showing readiness to fight even in perilous situations.
Unlatches his backpack when being shaken by the predator to escape, using presence of mind under extreme stress.
Runs with speed and agility through forest, dodging and diving into a river to evade pursuit.
Swept over a waterfall while evading the thanator, which may indicate a lack of control or being overwhelmed by the environment.
Thanks Neytiri for killing the viperwolves, showing gratitude.
Grasps Neytiri's shoulder impulsively and is struck by her in response.
Attempts to understand and reason about the conflict with Neytiri despite being reprimanded.
Allows Neytiri to silence him with her bow but calmly gets up to face her, showing resilience.
Uses sarcasm or irony when questioning Neytiri about why she saved him, demonstrating reflective thinking.
Asks Neytiri for help and requests to join her despite warnings.
Remains still and calm while surrounded by mysterious woodsprites, showing presence of mind.
Curiously studies the woodsprites without panic, demonstrating observational skills and composure.
Steps forward to meet Eytukan with a friendly greeting and offers his hand despite the tense situation.
Responds to Grace with a huge grin and reassures her that the avatar is safe.
Receives congratulations from others and responds modestly, acknowledging the unique experience.
Grinning and sharing with Quaritch that the Omaticaya want to study him and see if he can learn to be one of them.
Hauls himself from wheelchair to Link.
Grins and confidently interacts with villagers despite being new.
Nervously grips the mare's surcingle and clumsily mounts, showing lack of skill.
Engages in light banter and social interaction, showing some social capability.
Leans forward to get a better look out the front canopy, showing active engagement and curiosity.
Stares in amazement, both awe-inspired and disturbed, indicating emotional reaction to the floating mountains.
Climbs the large tree trunk out of breath but keeps up with Neytiri, reaches the branch successfully.
Expresses surprise loudly ('Holy shit') when seeing the mountain banshee.
Follows Neytiri's lead into unfamiliar terrain and situation without hesitation.
Creeps quietly with Neytiri, shows patience and restraint by not killing the hexapede when the forest hasn't given permission.
Comments with a smirk about 'treehugger shit,' indicating skepticism or sarcasm toward Neytiri's beliefs.
Rides well enough to keep up with experienced riders on a dangerous mountain trail near a sheer drop.
Observes and understands the significance of the Iknimaya (stairway to heaven) challenge, indicating attentiveness and preparation.
Leaps to catch up with Tsu'tey and the hunters as they start climbing the beanstalk, showing initiative and confidence.
Leaps to a passing vine with feet dangling over nothingness and climbs toward floating islands.
Leaps at the banshee, wrestles it, and forms a bond by physically merging his queue with its antenna despite the creature's resistance.
Commands the banshee sharply to be quiet during their first flight, showing firmness and control.
Accepts Neytiri's lead and learns flight from her, showing openness and willingness to connect.
Expresses joy and excitement while flying and interacting with Neytiri, displaying a friendly and sincere demeanor.
Hesitates before handing the memory chip to Trudy, torn by what he is doing.
Greets Grace and Norm with a casual 'Hey, guys.'
Joins the circle of dancers despite initial hesitation and channels the primal energy, dancing from the inside with confidence.
Takes Grace's hand and pulls her up, showing leadership and initiative.
Does not directly respond to Tsu'tey's accusation of cowardice, allowing the moment to pass without confrontation.
Reflects on the deep connection the People have to the forest and their spiritual energy cycle.
Appears isolated and introspective, expressing confusion and loss of identity in his video log.
Pulls himself from his wheelchair and hauls his useless legs into the Link despite physical limitations.
Admits to Norm and Grace the true purpose of his mission, showing honesty but also vulnerability.
Expresses internal conflict and hesitation about his loyalties and identity, showing indecision and feeling lost.
Demonstrates awareness of the political and personal risks of his decisions, showing strategic thinking.
Appears vulnerable and explains the difficult position he's in, showing honesty and emotional openness.
Smiles wanly and accepts the burden he carries without complaint, indicating endurance but also emotional isolation.
Lies comforted in Neytiri's arms as she shelters him while he sleeps.
Wakes up and thinks quietly alone in the dark, showing a reflective side.
Hurries to get back to the link when alerted, responding to urgent danger.
Sighs heavily and eats the eggs given by Grace despite initial reluctance, showing tolerance and acceptance.
Immediately responds to Grace's encouragement to eat despite his reluctance, showing readiness to prepare for action.
Lies awake in the link contemplating and does not act immediately to respond to the danger threatening Neytiri and the forest.
Dives off the dozer under fire and rescues Neytiri, then successfully conceals themselves in foliage.
Fights Tsu'tey fiercely but with respect, both fighting from the heart.
Becomes furious and shouts at Quaritch after he sabotages Grace's link.
Physically strikes Tsu'tey to win the fight, showing aggression.
Expresses deep understanding and sympathy for the Na'vi by acknowledging their unwillingness to give up their home and recognizing them as victims rather than enemies.
Shows alarm and dread when his recorded words are used against the Na'vi, indicating his sincere internal conflict and care for the people he has grown to love.
Recognizes and verbally acknowledges the manufactured nature of the conflict, showing understanding of the situation.
Responds quickly to Trudy’s urgent news about the gunships attacking Hometree, immediately moving to take action.
He is unable to meet Neytiri's eyes when confronted about his deception, indicating emotional struggle and lack of confidence in this moment.
Admits the truth about his mission and feelings despite the personal consequences, showing emotional honesty and some courage.
Does not resist when being captured by the Omaticaya hunters, which could show prudence in a losing situation rather than foolhardiness.
Yells to Neytiri, Tsu'tey, and others to get out of Hometree, begging them to run to the forest to escape danger.
Mo'at frees Jake from his bindings and entrusts him, showing faith; Jake takes the knife and cuts Grace free, helping her escape danger.
Kneels next to Neytiri, apologizes amid intense grief and rejection.
Staggers lost and alone through the burning forest, utterly shattered and vacant-eyed.
Pumps fist in triumph after evading gunfire during escape.
Immediately focuses on Grace's injury and begins first aid preparations under pressure.
Confidently confirms knowledge about strength of vortex at Well of Souls to guide navigation.
Stands slowly, barely holding it together after Grace's death but still raises his head and faces the clan with determination.
Speaks passionately and with fury to the clan, channeling both grief and resolve, and coordinates with Tsu'tey to translate, showing leadership and clear communication.
After loss and despair, quickly formulates and delivers a strategic call to action: to alert the other clans and unite them under Toruk Macto.
Takes initiative to rally multiple clans by flying out to summon them, demonstrating leadership and strategic coordination.
Successfully mounts a formidable leonopteryx and leads riders into battle, showing physical skill and confidence.
Speaks to another clan with Neytiri translating and gains the support of multiple diverse groups.
Leads a daring attack by charging directly down and screaming a war cry, displaying fearless leadership.
Successfully flies his great Leonopteryx, performing complex aerial maneuvers to take down a Scorpion gunship by slashing it and causing it to crash.
Manages to hold on despite the violent gyrations of his flying creature during combat, showing physical skill and mental focus under pressure.
Quickly adapts to aggressive enemy fire by banking and diving along the cliff to evade attacks, demonstrating situational awareness and piloting skill.
Observes the battlefield and gradually understands the involvement of Eywa in the fight.
Expresses surprise and excitement ('What the hell -- ?', 'WHOO-HOOOO!') but does not take immediate decisive action.
Throws grenades to disable the enemy shuttle engines during battle to protect his allies.
